get.description: Gets the Authorizers for an API.

parameters.description: The maximum number of elements to be returned for this resource.
parameters.name: maxResults

parameters.description:
The next page of elements from this collection. Not valid for the last element of
 the collection.
parameters.name: nextToken

post.description: Creates an Authorizer for an API.

authorizerResultTtlInSeconds.description: An integer with a value between [0-3600].

authorizerType.description:
The authorizer type. Currently the only valid value is REQUEST, for a
 Lambda function using incoming request parameters.

authorizerUri.description: A string representation of a URI with a length between [1-2048].

identitySource.description:
The identity source for which authorization is requested. For the REQUEST
 authorizer, this is required when authorization caching is enabled. The value is a
 comma-separated string of one or more mapping expressions of the specified request
 parameters. For example, if an Auth header, a Name query string parameter are defined
 as identity sources, this value is $method.request.header.Auth,
 $method.request.querystring.Name. These parameters will be used to derive
 the authorization caching key and to perform runtime validation of the REQUEST
 authorizer by verifying all of the identity-related request parameters are present,
 not null and non-empty. Only when this is true does the authorizer invoke the
 authorizer Lambda function, otherwise, it returns a 401 Unauthorized
 response without calling the Lambda function. The valid value is a string of
 comma-separated mapping expressions of the specified request parameters. When the
 authorization caching is not enabled, this property is optional.

identityValidationExpression.description: A string with a length between [0-1024].

name.description: A string with a length between [1-128].

providerArns.description: For REQUEST authorizer, this is not defined.

authorizerResultTtlInSeconds.description: An integer with a value between [0-3600].

authorizerType.description:
The authorizer type. Currently the only valid value is REQUEST, for a
 Lambda function using incoming request parameters.

authorizerUri.description: A string representation of a URI with a length between [1-2048].

identitySource.description:
The identity source for which authorization is requested. For the REQUEST
 authorizer, this is required when authorization caching is enabled. The value is a
 comma-separated string of one or more mapping expressions of the specified request
 parameters. For example, if an Auth header, a Name query string parameter are defined
 as identity sources, this value is $method.request.header.Auth,
 $method.request.querystring.Name. These parameters will be used to derive
 the authorization caching key and to perform runtime validation of the REQUEST
 authorizer by verifying all of the identity-related request parameters are present,
 not null and non-empty. Only when this is true does the authorizer invoke the
 authorizer Lambda function, otherwise, it returns a 401 Unauthorized
 response without calling the Lambda function. The valid value is a string of
 comma-separated mapping expressions of the specified request parameters. When the
 authorization caching is not enabled, this property is optional.

identityValidationExpression.description: A string with a length between [0-1024].

name.description: A string with a length between [1-128].

providerArns.description: For REQUEST authorizer, this is not defined.

parameters.description: The maximum number of elements to be returned for this resource.

parameters.description:
The next page of elements from this collection. Not valid for the last element of

connectionId.description: A string with a length between [1-1024].

contentHandlingStrategy.description: Specifies how to handle response payload content type conversions.

description.description: A string with a length between [0-1024].

integrationMethod.description: A string with a length between [1-64].

integrationType.description: Represents an API method integration type.

integrationUri.description: A string representation of a URI with a length between [1-2048].

passthroughBehavior.description: Represents passthrough behavior for an integration response.

requestParameters.description:
A key-value map specifying response parameters that are passed to the method
 response from the backend. The key is a method response header parameter name and the
 mapped value is an integration response header value, a static value enclosed within
 a pair of single quotes, or a JSON expression from the integration response body. The
 mapping key must match the pattern of method.response.header.{name}, where name is a
 valid and unique header name. The mapped non-static value must match the pattern of
 integration.response.header.{name} or integration.response.body.{JSON-expression},
 where name is a valid and unique response header name and JSON-expression is a valid
 JSON expression without the $ prefix.

requestTemplates.description:
A mapping of identifier keys to templates. The value is an actual template script.
 The key is typically a SelectionKey which is chosen based on evaluating
 a selection expression.

templateSelectionExpression.description: An expression used to extract information at runtime. See Selection Expressions for more information.

timeoutInMillis.description: An integer with a value between [50-29000].

contentHandlingStrategy.description: Specifies how to handle response payload content type conversions.

get.description: Gets the Routes for an API.

parameters.name: maxResults

parameters.description:
The next page of elements from this collection. Not valid for the last element of

post.description: Creates a Route for an API.

apiKeyRequired.description: Specifies whether an API key is required for the route.

authorizationScopes.description:
A list of authorization scopes configured on a route. The scopes are used with a
 COGNITO_USER_POOLS authorizer to authorize the method invocation. The authorization
 works by matching the route scopes against the scopes parsed from the access token in
 the incoming request. The method invocation is authorized if any route scope matches
 a claimed scope in the access token. Otherwise, the invocation is not authorized.
 When the route scope is configured, the client must provide an access token instead
 of an identity token for authorization purposes.

authorizationType.description:
The authorization type. Valid values are NONE for open access,
 AWS_IAM for using AWS IAM permissions, and CUSTOM for
 using a Lambda authorizer.

modelSelectionExpression.description: An expression used to extract information at runtime. See Selection Expressions for more information.

operationName.description: A string with a length between [1-64].

routeKey.description: After evaulating a selection expression, the result is compared against one or more selection keys to find a matching key. See Selection Expressions for a list of expressions and each expression's associated selection key type.

routeResponseSelectionExpression.description: An expression used to extract information at runtime. See Selection Expressions for more information.

target.description: A string with a length between [1-128].

apiKeyRequired.description: Specifies whether an API key is required for the route.

 works by matching the route scopes against the scopes parsed from the access token in
 the incoming request. The method invocation is authorized if any route scope matches
 a claimed scope in the access token. Otherwise, the invocation is not authorized.
 When the route scope is configured, the client must provide an access token instead
 of an identity token for authorization purposes.

AccessLogSettings.description: Settings for logging access in a stage.

AuthorizationScopes.description:
A list of authorization scopes configured on a route. The scopes are used with a
 COGNITO_USER_POOLS authorizer to authorize the method invocation. The authorization
 works by matching the route scopes against the scopes parsed from the access token in
 the incoming request. The method invocation is authorized if any route scope matches
 a claimed scope in the access token. Otherwise, the invocation is not authorized.
 When the route scope is configured, the client must provide an access token instead
 of an identity token for authorization purposes.

AuthorizationType.description:
The authorization type. Valid values are NONE for open access,
 AWS_IAM for using AWS IAM permissions, and CUSTOM for
 using a Lambda authorizer.

AuthorizerType.description:
The authorizer type. Currently the only valid value is REQUEST, for a
 Lambda function using incoming request parameters.

ContentHandlingStrategy.description: Specifies how to handle response payload content type conversions.

Deployment.description:
An immutable representation of an API that can be called by users. A
 Deployment must be associated with a Stage for it to be
 callable over the internet.

DomainNameStatus.description: The status of the domain name migration. The valid values are AVAILABLE and UPDATING. If the status is UPDATING, the domain cannot be modified further until the existing operation is complete. If it is AVAILABLE, the domain can be updated.

IdentitySourceList.description:
The identity source for which authorization is requested. For the REQUEST
 authorizer, this is required when authorization caching is enabled. The value is a
 comma-separated string of one or more mapping expressions of the specified request
 parameters. For example, if an Auth header, a Name query string parameter are defined
 as identity sources, this value is $method.request.header.Auth,
 $method.request.querystring.Name. These parameters will be used to derive
 the authorization caching key and to perform runtime validation of the REQUEST
 authorizer by verifying all of the identity-related request parameters are present,
 not null and non-empty. Only when this is true does the authorizer invoke the
 authorizer Lambda function, otherwise, it returns a 401 Unauthorized
 response without calling the Lambda function. The valid value is a string of
 comma-separated mapping expressions of the specified request parameters. When the
 authorization caching is not enabled, this property is optional.

IntegerWithLengthBetween0And3600.description: An integer with a value between [0-3600].

IntegerWithLengthBetween50And29000.description: An integer with a value between [50-29000].

IntegrationParameters.description:
A key-value map specifying response parameters that are passed to the method
 response from the backend. The key is a method response header parameter name and the
 mapped value is an integration response header value, a static value enclosed within
 a pair of single quotes, or a JSON expression from the integration response body. The
 mapping key must match the pattern of method.response.header.{name}, where name is a
 valid and unique header name. The mapped non-static value must match the pattern of
 integration.response.header.{name} or integration.response.body.{JSON-expression},
 where name is a valid and unique response header name and JSON-expression is a valid
 JSON expression without the $ prefix.

IntegrationType.description: Represents an API method integration type.

Model.description: Represents a data model for an API. See Create Models and Mapping Templates for Request and Response Mappings.

NextToken.description:
The next page of elements from this collection. Not valid for the last element of
 the collection.

ParameterConstraints.description:
Validation constraints imposed on parameters of a request (path, query string,
 headers).

PassthroughBehavior.description: Represents passthrough behavior for an integration response.

ProviderArnList.description: For REQUEST authorizer, this is not defined.

RouteSettings.description: Represents a collection of route settings.

SecurityPolicy.description: The Transport Layer Security (TLS) version of the security policy for this domain name. The valid values are TLS_1_0 and TLS_1_2.

SelectionExpression.description: An expression used to extract information at runtime. See Selection Expressions for more information.

SelectionKey.description: After evaulating a selection expression, the result is compared against one or more selection keys to find a matching key. See Selection Expressions for a list of expressions and each expression's associated selection key type.

StringWithLengthBetween1And64.description: A string with a length between [1-64].

TemplateMap.description:
A mapping of identifier keys to templates. The value is an actual template script.
 The key is typically a SelectionKey which is chosen based on evaluating
 a selection expression.

UriWithLengthBetween1And2048.description: A string representation of a URI with a length between [1-2048].
